    • Constructor Detail

      • Author

        public Author()
        Default constructor for objects of class Author.

      • Author

        public Author(Name name,
              Date born,
              Date died)
        Non-default constructor for objects of class Author. Similar to the preceding constructor, this one takes pre-determined info, but explicitly describes authors that were known not to have a pseudonym.
        Parameters:
        name - Name object that represents the real name given to the author at birth
        born - Date object that describes the author's recorded birthday
        died - Date the author kicked the bucket [optional: null means "hasn't died yet"]

      • Author

        public Author(Name name,
              Date born,
              Date died,
              Name pseudonym)
        Non-default constructor for objects of class Author. This constructor is used if all components of author have already been created.
        Parameters:
        name - Name object that represents the real name given to the author at birth
        born - Date object that describes the author's recorded birthday
        died - Date the author kicked the bucket [optional: null means "hasn't died yet"]
        pseudonym - a nom de plume that the author published works by [optional: null if no pseudonym]

      • Author

        public Author(java.lang.String firstName,
              java.lang.String lastName,
              java.lang.String middleName,
              int yearBorn,
              int monthBorn,
              int dayBorn,
              int yearDied,
              int monthDied,
              int dayDied,
              java.lang.String pseudoFirst,
              java.lang.String pseudoLast,
              java.lang.String pseudoMiddle)
        Non-default constructor for objects of class Author. This is the most verbose means of describing an Author. All the attributes of this class' components are provided here. Contrary to the other constructors, this one doesn't allow a death-date to be optional.
        Parameters:
        firstName - this person's given name
        lastName - this person's surname
        middleName - one middle name given to the author by their family [optional: null means "no middle name"]
        yearBorn - their year of birth, expressed in the Common Era
        monthBorn - their month of birth, in the range Date.JANUARY to Date.DECEMBER
        dayBorn - their day of birth, in the range 1 to (max day number of that month and year)
        yearDied - their year of death, expressed in the Common Era
        monthDied - their month of death; same range as monthBorn
        dayDied - their day of death; same range as dayBorn
        pseudoFirst - the first name that appears in their nom de plume
        pseudoLast - the last name that appears in their nom de plume
        pseudoMiddle - one middle name for the nom de plume, if applicable Only if all the pseudo-params are null will the pseudoname be considered non-existent. Every other combination will be passed on to Name() for that class' interpretation.

    • Method Detail

      • getAgeYearsOfAuthor

        public int getAgeYearsOfAuthor()
        Answers the question, "how old would the author be if alive today?" I guess corpses could be said to age - like a fine wine?
        Returns:
        the difference of the author's birth year and this year (Never meant to be a perfect answer. 'Today' is treated as Jan 1, 2013.)

      • isAuthorAlive

        public boolean isAuthorAlive()
        A more common way of asking, "has (s)he not died yet?"
        Returns:
        true: (s)he has a date of death on record; false otherwise

      • setDateBorn

        public void setDateBorn(Date born)
        Mutator. No validation performed, though in the best case, it'd be before 'died'.
        Parameters:
